column4: hi linux gurus, i am installing ubntu 8.04 on a newly built system. at the prepare partitions screen, it's not showing either of my SATA hdds, though they're detected by the BIOS. what should i do?
you've tried "sudo fdisk -l" ?
no, and i don't see a place to type in any commands
Applications > Acessories > Terminal
the OS hasn't been installed yet. there are no menus.
But the Live CD should load anyway. You'll have an experimental desktop with an "Install" in the desktop
ah ok. i do have the live CD but i'm not running it in live mode, just went straight to install

the command you need to memorize when you're there is "sudo fdisk -l" This will take a look at your disks and list all partitions. Once you get your system installed you'll have loads of time to try out the terminal
you should have no problem. That command will show us if it's truly not seeing anything. You can use IRC from within the LiveCD so we can give you a hand once you're there
nothing at all?
sudo fdisk -l <-- that's a small L just in case you entered a caps i
you're you installed the disks correctly?
i don't know what i could have done wrong, just plugged in SATA signal and power cables to the mainboard
you also connected them to power source?
hmm. I don't them. But now I'm wondering if it's unpartioned space would appear in fdisk. Try cfdisk /dev/sda
sorry. You have to prefix that command with sudo
oh, you did add sudo. Hmmmm
try also "sudo cfdisk /dev/hda"
i get the same error
there's an application somewhere called gparted. Look for it in the menus ( I don't have it installed so I don't know where it is)
did you figure out what was wrong?
i rebooted, loaded up the live session, and ran the installer. at the partitioning screen, the same thing is happening. no hard disks displayed and i can't proceed.
that's really strange. Only thing that occurs to me is some problem with the disks installation. You'll have to ask around and say that nothing appears appears under "sudo fdisk -l"
